definition: to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech

sentences.english: The accused begged for the court's understand.
I entreat you, give no place to despondency.
sentences.chinese: 我懇求你，不要爲沮喪留地步。

sentences.english: We have not bound your feet with our entreating arms.
sentences.chinese: 我們不曾用懇求的手臂來抱住你的雙足。

sentences.english: Obviously , he was moved by her entreaties.
sentences.chinese: 顯然，他被她的懇求打動了。

sentences.english: Timur and the tearful Liù also beg him not to risk his life.
sentences.chinese: 帖木兒和柳兒亦含淚懇求他不要冒險。

sentences.english: His father, Michael Douglas, wrote a letter to the judge asking for leniency.
sentences.chinese: 父親道格拉斯致函法官懇求寬大處理。

sentences.english: The prophet bid all people to become good persons.
sentences.chinese: 預言者懇求所有的人變成好人。
我懇求免除分派的那個任務。

sentences.english: He beseeched the Lord to allow the old man’s soul into heaven.
sentences.chinese: 他懇求上帝接納這老人的靈魂於天堂。

sentences.english: The firefighters begged him to jump again and again.
sentences.chinese: 消防隊員們一遍又一遍地懇求他跳下來。

sentences.english: Frank begged him to do so and the dealer reluctantly prised it open.
sentences.chinese: 經弗蘭懇求，古董商才勉強把貨箱撬開了。

sentences.english: Take her back to your people, " she begged.
sentences.chinese: 把她帶回去給你們的人，”她懇求道。

sentences.english: Sunny again TianCun supplication hope son can think method to assist the text.
sentences.chinese: 晴子一再懇求希望田村可以想方法來協助文子。

sentences.english: He felt very uncomfortable and looked entreaty at us.
sentences.chinese: 他感到很不自在，用懇求的目光望着我們。

definition: to lament/to complain tearfully/to wail accusingly
in fear and trepidation (idiom); in reverence before your majesty (court formula of humility)
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
to bid farewell/to part (usually with little hope of meeting again)
to be determined to/to insist on
elder brother/term of respect for a man of about the same age
lit. to open the door and see the mountain; fig. to get right to the point (idiom)
